column71:
Adecco er markedsleder, når det gælder vikar- og rekrutteringsløsninger.
Sådan er det både globalt og lokalt, hvor vi har 12 kontorer fordelt rundt omkring i landet. Dermed er vi både tæt på dig og vores kunder.

column98: Technical Support Engineer for an international fast-growing company
column99:
Do you have a technical background in electronics? Are you passionate about digital technology and renewable energy? Do you have knowledge of photovoltaic and electrical energy storage systems? Then we have a unique opportunity for you in an international fast-growing company! 
   
 Solar Inverter Service and Technical Support department at Photomate is looking for Technical Support Engineer to fill the newly opened position in the Stockholm area, who can support company business in Scandinavia (Denmark/Sweden). 
   
 Photomate is a regional leader in the distribution of inverters for photovoltaics and electric energy storage systems. Our team of more than 50 employees is active in 15 European countries, and our headquarter is located in České Budějovice, Czech Republic with subsidiaries in Ukraine, Poland, Hungary, Bulgaria, Romania, Georgia, Slovakia, Estonia, and Danmark (Scandinavian). 
   
 Photomate Scandinavia was established in March 2020 in Sønderborg, Denmark. We have had a good start and are now expanding our activities at a rapid pace. Our mission is to become Scandinavia's leading supplier of photovoltaic systems and electrical energy storage systems. Therefore, we are looking for our new colleague in the Stockholm area in Sweden. 
   
 You enjoy working with technical issues and supporting clients in the Swedish market. You put an effort in working closely with clients and giving them a superior client experience. You perceive yourself as a good communicator and stakeholder manager. And you would like to be a part of an exciting international organization.  
   
 Furthermore, your main responsibility will be: 
   
 
 solar inverter commissioning, inverter troubleshooting, and warranty replacements 
 providing knowledge of Huawei solar products at technical workshops to the clients 
 Huawei solution application consulting 
 close cooperation with the sales team 
 technical analysis and client advising of PV plant configuration 
 preparing technical documents for tender applications 
 technical support and troubleshooting – online and telephone 
 to communicate with our clients and stakeholder management 
 
   
 To succeed in this role, you have an electrical technical background, knowledge of digital technology, an interest in solar technology, and enjoy stakeholder management since supporting clients with technical issues is paramount. Good communication skills and the ability to build strong customer relationships are also essential. 
   
 Furthermore, your main professional skills we expect from you are: 
   
 
 a degree in electrical engineering/electronics/power engineering or similar and 2-3 years of relevant technical experience 
 an interest in and knowledge about digital technology 
 experience in the solar PV industry, PVSyst software, and knowledge of other languages will be an advantage 
 the ability to train technicians in technical support 
 being good at problem-solving 
 excellent communication and presentation skills and being an effective team player 
 that you master Swedish and English at a professional level and understand the Scandinavian languages. 
 a driving license 
 
   
 We expect a problem-solving, pleasant and fair person who will appreciate the same approach from our team members. 
   
 Furthermore, your main personal skills we expect from you are: 
   
 
 that you have an outgoing personality 
 that you master the art of stakeholder management 
 that you are trustworthy 
 
   
 Your work location will be in the Stockholm area in Sweden, and you will work in close collaboration with the Scandinavian Manager, the Technical Support Engineer in Southern Sweden as well as external colleagues in different countries with various backgrounds. You will have the opportunity to work remotely some days during the week. 
   
 We offer you an exciting job opportunity in an international fast-growing company where you will be professionally developed through challenging projects in the PV industry. 
   
 We are looking forward to hearing from you 
   
 Apply now by using the “Apply” -button, preferably as quickly as possible. Photomate is cooperating with Adecco on this recruitment process. If you have any questions, please contact Research Consultant Daniel Herlev Moldavsky – E: daniel.moldavsky@adecco.dk
